snippet: A midwinter storm buried several states in snow, leaving behind a debilitated region digging through plump white drifts and reeling from gale-force winds.
abstract: Gigantic midwinter storm buries Northeast in snow, leaving behind debilitated and disoriented region; storm, spawned by collision of two weather systems, touches more than 40 million people, though early reports suggest it accounts for only a handful of deaths.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood, Robert Davey, Ann Farmer, Dina Kraft, Elizabeth Maker, Eli Rosenberg, Nate Schweber, Michael Schwirtz, Katharine Q. Seelye, Ravi Somaiya, Alex Vadukul and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: A midwinter storm buried several states in snow, leaving behind a debilitated region digging through plump white drifts and reeling from gale-force winds.

headline.seo: Heavy Snow and Winds Batter Northeast
headline.main: Storm Leaves Northeast Reeling and Digging
headline.print_headline: Huge Storm Swipes City and Buries Northeast
